newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-ANDERSON MOVE CLOSE TO COMPLETION.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ANDERSON MOVE CLOSE TO COMPLETION.

text.p: Barcelona's signing of Brazilian striker Sonny Anderson is nearly finalised, club officals said on Friday.
Reports in the Spanish media suggested that the Catalan club had offered Monaco three billion pesetas ($20 million) for Anderson.
Barcelona have been keen on signing a big-name striker since Ronaldo made it clear several months ago that he was likely to leave the club.
They initially set their sights on Argentinian Gabriel Batistuta but talks broke down.
Barcelona are not the only major Spanish club still looking to sign players despite the hectic transfer activity since the end of last season.
Rivals Real Madrid are trying to find a central defender to replace Spanish international Rafael Alkorta, who has moved to Athletic Bilbao.
The Spanish champions have been linked with the Italian pair of Lazio's Paolo Negro and Bologna's Stefano Torrisi.
